intro: Tragia adenophila var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features.
